In a quiet town, there lived a peculiar dog named Whiskers. Unlike other dogs, he never barked, causing many to believe he was mute. One stormy night, the townsfolk heard a series of eerie howls echoing through the streets. Panic ensued, and they rushed to their homes, leaving the mysterious sounds unanswered. But Whiskers sat calmly at his owner’s feet, his eyes glimmering with a secret. As dawn broke, the townsfolk discovered that the howls were a warning—a pack of wolves was approaching. Whiskers, the silent guardian, had known all along, his stillness the key to their safety.
